conclusion: Determine the total magnitude of the Ampere force on the entire wire frame.
A semi-circular wire frame with radius r and a straight segment MN is fixed in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to its plane.
The straight segment MN has an Ampere force F.
The Ampere force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = I ∫ dℓ × B.
For the straight segment MN, dℓ × B points in the same direction for every dℓ.
The length of the straight segment is r.
The magnitude of the force on the straight segment is F = I r B.
The radius of the semi-circle is r, and the angle subtended is π radians.
For the semi-circular segment QN, dℓ × B points in the same direction for every dℓ.
The length of the semi-circular segment is πr.
The magnitude of the force on the semi-circular segment is F_semi-circular = I (π r) B = π I r B.
The total force on the entire wire frame is the sum of the forces on the straight segment and the semi-circular segment.
Substituting the expressions for the individual forces, F_total = I r B + π I r B = I r B (1 + π).
Given that F = I r B, F_total = F (1 + π).
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame is F(1+π).
